text: Heteropurpura is an extinct genus of predatory sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Muricidae, the rock snails or murex snails. ==Fossil records== The fossil record of this species dates back to the Pliocene (age range: 3.6 to 2.588 million years ago). These fossils have been found in Italy and Spain.Fossilworks ==Description== Shells of Heteropurpura species can reach a size of about .Malachia ==Species== * †Heteropurpura polymorpha Brocchi 1814 ==References== Category:Monotypic gastropod genera Category:Muricidae
title: Heteropurpura
